articles.title: Stocks Hit Record as Traders Shrug Off US Shutdown: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: A record-breaking global stock rally stretched into Asia, with equities advancing after OpenAI’s agreement with South Korean chipmakers reinforced enthusiasm for artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Bad Bunny could see ICE at Super Bowl show, Trump official suggests - Axios
articles.description: "There is nowhere that you can provide safe haven to people in this country illegally," Corey Lewandowski said.

articles.title: FBI cuts ties with Anti-Defamation League amid conservative backlash - Al Jazeera
articles.description: FBI Director Kash Patel announces break with anti-Semitism watchdog amid outrage over description of Charlie Kirk.

articles.title: Trump signs an executive order vowing to defend Qatar in the wake of Israel’s strike - AP News
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump has signed an executive order pledging to defend Qatar, including using U.S. military action if necessary. The order emphasizes the close cooperation and shared interests between the U.S. and Qatar. It follows Israel's surprise att…

articles.title: Musk becomes first person ever to see wealth top $500bn - BBC
articles.description: The rise has been driven by a sharp increase in the value of his electric car company Tesla.

articles.title: How John Thune sees the shutdown ending - Politico
articles.description: The Senate majority leader told POLITICO what a Democratic capitulation might look like.

articles.title: Macron says oil tanker off France is linked to Russia's shadow fleet and committed "serious wrongdoings" - CBS News
articles.description: French naval forces forcibly boarded the tanker known as "Pushpa" or "Boracay" a few days ago at the request of prosecutors who suspected wrongdoing.

articles.title: Supreme Court allows Lisa Cook to remain on Fed board for now - The Washington Post
articles.description: The Supreme Court ruling means Cook can remain on the Fed board at least until January, when the court will hear the case. Trump has pushed to remove her.

articles.title: Minnesota reports 13 more measles cases, raising 2025 total to 18 - Star Tribune
articles.description: This year’s total is the fifth-highest in at least 15 years in the state, where the measles vaccination rate is weakening. None of the people most recently infected were vaccinated.

articles.title: Pentagon plans widespread random polygraphs, NDAs to stanch leaks - The Washington Post
articles.description: The Pentagon is planning to require thousands of uniformed and civilian officials to sign nondisclosure agreements and submit to random polygraph testing.

articles.title: Victims in deadly shooting at North Carolina waterfront bar identified: "She loved others deeply" - CBS News
articles.description: The patrons of the American Fish Company who were killed in the shooting on Saturday night were identified on Wednesday.

articles.title: Apple sidelines lighter Vision Pro to prioritize smart glasses - The Verge
articles.description: Apple is speeding up work on smart glasses that would compete with similar offerings from Meta and halting plans for a lighter Vision Pro headset, Bloomberg reports.

articles.title: 5 players to watch for the short-handed 49ers vs. the Rams on TNF - Niners Nation
articles.description: Who needs to step up for the San Francisco 49ers on Thursday against the Los Angeles Rams? Let’s break down 5 key players that need to have an impact.

articles.title: Nicole Kidman wished Keith Urban was more supportive of her career before filing for divorce, report says: The latest on the estranged couple - Yahoo
articles.description: Kidman listed their date of separation as the date of filing, Sept. 30, and cited irreconcilable differences as the reason for their breakup.
